(51116, 53605).description: The exchange of carbon dioxide between the ocean and atmosphere, an important component of the global carbon cycle

(51116, 53605).name: MPI-OM
(51116, 53605).label: model
(51116, 53605).description: The Max Planck Institute Ocean Model, a component of the MPI-ESM climate model used to simulate ocean circulation and biogeochemistry

(51116, 53605).name: HAMOCC5
(51116, 53605).label: model
(51116, 53605).description: The Hamburg Ocean Carbon Cycle Model, a module used to simulate ocean biogeochemistry and marine biology in the MPI-ESM climate model

(51116, 53605).name: JSBACH
(51116, 53605).label: model
(51116, 53605).description: The Jena Scheme for Biosphere-Atmosphere Coupling in Hamburg, a land surface model used in the MPI-ESM climate model to simulate energy, water, and carbon fluxes between land and atmosphere

(51116, 53605).name: MPI-ESM
(51116, 53605).label: model
(51116, 53605).description: The Max Planck Institute Earth System Model, a fully coupled climate model that simulates the interactions between the atmosphere, ocean, land, and sea ice

(51116, 53605).name: CESM1-BGC
(51116, 53605).label: model
(51116, 53605).description: The Community Earth System Model version 1 with biogeochemistry, a climate model used to simulate the Earth's climate system and its response to different scenarios

(51116, 53605).name: CCSM4
(51116, 53605).label: model
(51116, 53605).description: The Community Climate System Model version 4, a predecessor to the CESM1 model

(51116, 53605).name: CMIP5
(51116, 53605).label: project
(51116, 53605).description: The Coupled Model Intercomparison Project Phase 5, a framework for comparing different climate models to improve climate predictions

(51116, 53605).name: National Centre for Atmospheric Research
(51116, 53605).label: provider
(51116, 53605).description: A research institution that develops and applies computer models to understand the Earth's climate system

(51116, 53605).name: atmosphere
(51116, 53605).label: location
(51116, 53605).description: The layer of gases surrounding the Earth, playing a crucial role in regulating the planet's climate

(51116, 53605).name: ocean
(51116, 53605).label: location
(51116, 53605).description: The vast body of saltwater that covers over 70% of the Earth's surface, influencing global climate patterns and weather events

(51116, 53605).name: land
(51116, 53605).label: location
(51116, 53605).description: The solid surface of the Earth, comprising continents, islands, and underwater landmasses, and supporting a wide range of ecosystems and human activities

(51116, 53605).name: sea ice
(51116, 53605).label: location
(51116, 53605).description: Frozen seawater that forms in polar regions, playing a critical role in the Earth's climate system by reflecting sunlight and influencing ocean currents

(53154, 55734).name: CESM1-BGC
(53154, 55734).label: model
(53154, 55734).description: A version of the Community Earth System Model with biogeochemistry modules enabled

(53154, 55734).name: National Centre for Atmospheric Research
(53154, 55734).label: provider
(53154, 55734).description: A research institution that manages and maintains the Community Earth System Model

(53154, 55734).name: biogeochemistry
(53154, 55734).label: variable
(53154, 55734).description: The study of the interaction between living organisms and the Earth's physical environment, including the cycling of nutrients and elements

(53154, 55734).name: marine ecosystem module
(53154, 55734).label: model
(53154, 55734).description: A module within the Community Earth System Model that simulates the interactions between marine organisms and their environment

(53154, 55734).name: CLM4
(53154, 55734).label: model
(53154, 55734).description: The Community Land Model version 4, a component of the Community Earth System Model that simulates land surface processes

(53154, 55734).name: NorESM-ME
(53154, 55734).label: model
(53154, 55734).description: The Norwegian Earth System Model, a modified version of the Community Earth System Model

(53154, 55734).name: atmospheric chemistry
(53154, 55734).label: variable
(53154, 55734).description: The study of the chemical composition and reactions that occur in the Earth's atmosphere

(53154, 55734).name: aeolian deposition
(53154, 55734).label: variable
(53154, 55734).description: The process by which wind transports and deposits particles, such as dust and nutrients, onto land and ocean surfaces

(53154, 55734).name: ocean
(53154, 55734).label: location
(53154, 55734).description: The world's oceans, which play a critical role in the Earth's climate system

(53154, 55734).name: land
(53154, 55734).label: location
(53154, 55734).description: The Earth's land surfaces, which interact with the atmosphere and oceans to influence climate

(53154, 55734).name: sea ice
(53154, 55734).label: location
(53154, 55734).description: The frozen sea water that forms in polar regions, which plays a key role in the Earth's climate system

(53154, 55734).name: annual net primary productivity
(53154, 55734).label: variable
(53154, 55734).description: A measure of the amount of organic matter produced by plants and other organisms in a given area over a year

(53154, 55734).name: marine biological production
(53154, 55734).label: variable
(53154, 55734).description: The process by which marine organisms, such as phytoplankton, produce organic matter through photosynthesis

(53154, 55734).name: Norwegian Climate Centre
(53154, 55734).label: provider
(53154, 55734).description: A research institution that develops and maintains the Norwegian Earth System Model

(55276, 57597).name: OCMIP
(55276, 57597).label: project
(55276, 57597).description: The Ocean Carbon-Cycle Model Intercomparison Project, a framework for comparing different ocean carbon cycle models to improve climate predictions

(55276, 57597).name: CLM4
(55276, 57597).label: model
(55276, 57597).description: The Community Land Model version 4, a model used to simulate land surface processes and interactions with the atmosphere

(55276, 57597).name: NorESM
(55276, 57597).label: model
(55276, 57597).description: The Norwegian Earth System Model, a comprehensive climate model that integrates physical, chemical, and biological processes to simulate Earth's climate system

(55276, 57597).name: HadGEM2-ES
(55276, 57597).label: model
(55276, 57597).description: The Hadley Centre Global Environment Model version 2, Earth System configuration, a climate model that couples interactive ocean biogeochemistry, terrestrial biogeochemistry, and atmospheric chemistry

(55276, 57597).name: CMIP5
(55276, 57597).label: project
(55276, 57597).description: The Coupled Model Intercomparison Project Phase 5, a framework for comparing different climate models to improve climate predictions

(55276, 57597).name: ocean
(55276, 57597).label: location
(55276, 57597).description: The ocean, a major component of the Earth's climate system, playing a key role in global climate regulation

(55276, 57597).name: atmosphere
(55276, 57597).label: location
(55276, 57597).description: The atmosphere, the layer of gases surrounding the Earth, influencing global climate patterns

(55276, 57597).name: marine biological production
(55276, 57597).label: variable
(55276, 57597).description: The process by which marine organisms produce organic matter through photosynthesis, an important component of the ocean carbon cycle

(55276, 57597).name: soil organic matter
(55276, 57597).label: variable
(55276, 57597).description: The amount of organic matter in soil, influencing soil fertility and carbon sequestration

(55276, 57597).name: iron
(55276, 57597).label: variable
(55276, 57597).description: A chemical element essential for many biological processes, including marine phytoplankton growth

(55276, 57597).name: land surface
(55276, 57597).label: location
(55276, 57597).description: The surface of the land, interacting with the atmosphere and influencing climate patterns

(55276, 57597).name: terrestrial carbon cycle
(55276, 57597).label: variable
(55276, 57597).description: The process by which carbon is exchanged between the land surface and the atmosphere, an important component of the global carbon cycle

(55276, 57597).name: carbon
(55276, 57597).label: variable
(55276, 57597).description: A chemical element essential for life, playing a key role in the global carbon cycle

(55276, 57597).name: physical model
(55276, 57597).label: model
(55276, 57597).description: A computational representation of physical processes used to simulate and predict weather, climate, and environmental phenomena

(55276, 57597).name: vegetation
(55276, 57597).label: variable
(55276, 57597).description: Plant life, influencing climate patterns through carbon sequestration and evapotranspiration

(55276, 57597).name: interactive ocean biogeochemistry
(55276, 57597).label: model
(55276, 57597).description: A component of climate models that simulates the interactions between the ocean and the biogeochemical cycles of carbon, nitrogen, and other elements

(55276, 57597).label: model
(55276, 57597).description: A component of climate models that simulates the interactions between the land surface and the biogeochemical cycles of carbon, nitrogen, and other elements

(55276, 57597).name: interactive atmospheric chemistry
(55276, 57597).label: model

(55276, 57597).name: Nitrogen deposition
(55276, 57597).label: variable

(57192, 59328).name: MOSES2
(57192, 59328).label: model
(57192, 59328).description: The Met Office Surface Exchange Scheme version 2, a land surface model that simulates the exchange of water, energy, and carbon between the land surface and the atmosphere

(57192, 59328).name: UVic ESCM
(57192, 59328).label: model
(57192, 59328).description: The University of Victoria Earth System Climate Model, a climate model that consists of a primitive equation 3D OGCM coupled to a dynamic-thermodynamic sea ice model and an energy-moisture balance model of the atmosphere

(57192, 59328).name: CMIP
(57192, 59328).label: project
(57192, 59328).description: The Coupled Model Intercomparison Project, a framework for comparing different climate models to improve climate predictions

(57192, 59328).name: World Climate Research Programme's Working Group
(57192, 59328).label: provider

(57192, 59328).name: University of Victoria
(57192, 59328).label: provider
(57192, 59328).description: A Canadian university that is involved in climate research and the development of climate models

(57192, 59328).name: land surface
(57192, 59328).label: location
(57192, 59328).description: The surface of the Earth's land, including soil, vegetation, and other features

(57192, 59328).name: atmosphere
(57192, 59328).label: location
(57192, 59328).description: The layer of gases that surrounds the Earth, including the troposphere, stratosphere, and other layers

(57192, 59328).name: ocean
(57192, 59328).label: location
(57192, 59328).description: The body of saltwater that covers most of the Earth's surface, including the open ocean and coastal areas

(57192, 59328).name: land ice
(57192, 59328).label: location
(57192, 59328).description: Ice that forms on land, including glaciers, ice sheets, and other types of ice

(57192, 59328).name: carbon
(57192, 59328).label: variable
(57192, 59328).description: A chemical element that is a key component of the Earth's climate system, including the carbon cycle and the exchange of carbon between the atmosphere, oceans, and land

(57192, 59328).name: soil carbon
(57192, 59328).label: variable
(57192, 59328).description: The amount of carbon stored in soils, including organic and inorganic forms

(57192, 59328).name: land carbon fluxes

(57192, 59328).description: The exchange of carbon between the land surface and the atmosphere, including the uptake and release of carbon by vegetation and soils

(57192, 59328).name: ocean carbon
